remarks: An isomorphism in the category of sets is a bijection.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
statement:
setcmon.c $e |- C = ( SetCat ` U ) $.
setcmon.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. V ) $.
setcmon.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. U ) $.
setcmon.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. U ) $.
setciso.n $e |- I = ( Iso ` C ) $.
setciso $p |- ( ph -> ( F e. ( X I Y ) <-> F : X -1-1-onto-> Y ) ) $.
